If you‚Äôre getting started with **[Azure Local](https://www.thomasmaurer.ch/2025/10/new-video-azure-local-overview/)** and want a clear, practical path to creating and managing virtual machines (VMs) on‚Äëpremises with a **cloud‚Äënative** experience, this walkthrough is for you. In the companion video, I demo three approaches side‚Äëby‚Äëside‚Äî**Azure Portal**, **Azure CLI**, and **Infrastructure‚Äëas‚ÄëCode (IaC)** with **Bicep**‚Äîso you can pick the workflow that fits your team and governance model. Azure Local brings Azure‚Äôs control plane to your datacenter via Azure Arc, so you can run VMs, containers, and select Azure services with consistent tooling and policy.

## Why Azure Local for VMs?

Azure Local extends Azure to customer‚Äëowned environments while keeping a consistent management plane‚Äî**Azure portal, Azure CLI, ARM/Bicep**‚Äîand unifies operations with Azure Arc. It‚Äôs designed for low‚Äëlatency scenarios, regulated workloads, and **sovereign/private cloud** needs, while still letting you use familiar Azure services (Policy, Defender for Cloud, Monitor, and more) from a single pane of glass.

Key benefits for VM admins include:

- Centralized, RBAC‚Äëdriven self‚Äëservice VM management via Azure‚Äîcreate, modify, delete VMs and VM resources (disks, logical networks, NICs, images) without hopping between tools.
- Multiple automation paths: Portal, **Azure CLI**, **ARM/Bicep** (and Terraform) for repeatable deployments.

## What you‚Äôll learn (and what I show in the video)

- **Create a VM on Azure Local using the Azure Portal**
- **Deploy a VM using the Azure CLI**
- **Automate VM creation with Bicep (IaC)**
